function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Critique of the biodiversity-buffers-disease paradigm","Impact":"Undermines the justification for wildlife conservation and biodiversity increase","Mitigation":"Conduct further research in complex systems to understand the relationship between biodiversity and disease propagation","Technologies":"Environmental monitoring and modeling technologies","People":"Environmental researchers, conservationists","Owner":"Research institutions, environmental organizations"},{"Description":"Non-linear relationship between biodiversity and dilution effect","Impact":"Challenges the assumption that increasing biodiversity always leads to disease mitigation","Mitigation":"Explore the composition of the wildlife community and its impact on disease prevalence","Technologies":"Biodiversity mapping and ecological modeling technologies","People":"Ecologists, disease researchers","Owner":"Research institutions, ecological organizations"},{"Description":"Adding non-competent and competent host species in city environments","Impact":"May not always have a disease-protective value and could increase disease risk","Mitigation":"Conduct risk assessments before introducing new species into city environments","Technologies":"Ecological impact assessment and predictive modeling technologies","People":"City planners, environmental regulators","Owner":"Municipalities, environmental agencies"}]}
